snippet: The problem is especially urgent in Buffalo, where federal officials are promoting minority access to the better parts of a dysfunctional system.
abstract: Editorial laments that New York State's public schools are most segregated in America; says state is obligated to ensure that as many children as possible leave failing schools, and that this can be accomplished through voluntary transfer plans and high-quality magnet schools; holds up Buffalo as example of past success of such schools, and of dysfunction that can occur when intervention is scaled back.
lead_paragraph: The problem is especially urgent in Buffalo, where federal officials are promoting minority access to the better parts of a dysfunctional system.
